page.title: 03ARTS CRAFTS & FUN IN CANNICH
page.content: The Scottish Women's Rural Institute {(SWRI)}hold regular meetings and cover a wide area of interests particularly in the field of{arts and crafts. }The WRI ladies are very talented and hold regular and varied competitions and meetings. Open nights are also held to which anyone in the area is invited. There is a{Country Dancing}Club which often holds rallies and has exchange visits with clubs from neighbouring areas. There is also a{Youth Club which meets weekly in the local hall. All clubs regularly hold jumble sales, sales of work, whist drives, discos and ceilidhs (concerts with singing and dancing interspersed) to supplement club funds and to help local charities. Burns Suppers, Hallowe'en parties, Xmas parties and Senior Citizens parties are also held by the various{clubs.
